summary: This document is a detailed telephone billing statement for an account, showing numerous calls made and received over several days in September 2006. The calls are primarily to/from locations in New York, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, and New York City, with many being mobile-to-mobile calls. It appears to be a financial record documenting communication patterns. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for an account, covering calls from September 9-15, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from the White Plains, NY area, with numerous calls to other New York City boroughs. The bill includes mobile-to-mobile calls, incoming calls, and calls to directory assistance. This document is a series of itemized telephone billing statements from T-Mobile, covering calls made and received from September 15, 2006, to October 21, 2006. The records show a high volume of calls, primarily to and from White Plains, NY, and New York, NY, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document appears to be part of financial evidence, likely subpoenaed to establish communication patterns. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 25-36 of 71) for an account, showing numerous calls made and received over several days in September 2006. The calls are predominantly to/from a location identified as 'White Pls, NY' (likely White Plains, New York), with other calls to New York City boroughs and incoming calls. The record appears to be part of financial evidence collection. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for an account, covering calls from September 28, 2006, to October 6, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from the White Plains, NY area, with numerous short-duration calls, suggesting potential coordination or frequent check-ins. The document is part of the financial records in the Epstein case, likely used to establish patterns of communication. This document is a detailed itemized telephone bill for an account, covering calls from October 6-12, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from a location in White Plains, NY, with many calls occurring in the early morning hours and marked as mobile-to-mobile. The bill appears to be part of financial records collected in the Epstein investigation. This document is a detailed itemized telephone bill for an account, covering calls from October 12-20, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from the White Plains, NY area, with numerous mobile-to-mobile calls. The bill totals $23.84 in usage charges. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill itemizing call details for an account from October 21-29, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, predominantly to and from a location in White Plains, NY, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document is significant as it provides a detailed communication log that could be used to establish patterns of contact and location during the investigation. This document is a series of pages from a T-Mobile itemized phone bill, covering calls made and received from October 29-31, 2006. The bill shows numerous calls originating from or terminating in White Plains, NY, and other New York City boroughs, with most calls being mobile-to-mobile. It appears to be a financial record submitted as evidence.

events.title: Phone Activity Log
events.description: Detailed log of phone calls made and received on a T-Mobile account, showing numerous calls to/from White Plains, NY, and New York, NY.

locations: White Pls, NY (White Plains, New York)
keyFacts: The document is a telephone billing statement dated September 21, 2006, covering calls from September 4-9, 2006.
A high volume of calls, predominantly mobile-to-mobile, were made to and from locations in White Plains, NY.
Other frequent call destinations include the Bronx, Queens, and New York City, NY.
The account utilized services like 'DirAsst' (Directory Assistance) and 'Cust Care' (Customer Care).
The record shows a pattern of frequent, short-duration calls, particularly clustered around specific times and locations.
The phone bill shows an extremely high volume of calls over a one-week period in September 2006, with hundreds of calls logged.
The majority of calls are to and from the White Plains, NY area, suggesting it was a primary location of activity for the account holder.
Frequent calls were also made to various New York City boroughs (Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan).
The document is a financial record that could be used to establish communication patterns and geographic movements.
The bill includes calls to directory assistance and voicemail retrieval, indicating routine phone usage.
The document is a detailed telephone billing record spanning from September 15, 2006, to October 21, 2006.
It shows an extremely high volume of calls, with hundreds of entries over a short period, primarily to/from White Plains, NY, and New York, NY.
A significant number of calls are marked as 'Mobile2Mobile' (Call Type F), indicating communication between cell phones on the same network.
The bill includes charges for voicemail retrieval, directory assistance, and messaging, with a total usage charge of $38.35 for the period.
